course_title: Special Topics: QTM: Intro ML, Forecasting, & Optim
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 30 / Seats Avail: 14Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)


Prerequisites: QTM 100 or (QTM 110 and QTM 150 and QTM 151 and QTM 210)
QTM permission code form (same for all QTM classes): https://forms.office.com/r/bq8grdpG25
Full topic: Machine Learning, Forecasting, and Optimization - A Hands-on Introduction
This course will proceed through a series of hands-on projects introduced by lectures and applied tutorials. Through those projects, students will learn the basics of automated computer functionalities most commonly implemented in the industry. These projects will cover simple Machine Learning tasks, more advanced ones such as basic computer vision, as well as introductions to forecasting and optimization. Computational methods to solve each project will be introduced in class and through tutorials. The language used will be either R or Python. Student will have to code and deliver their own projects in one of these two programming languages.
course_description: Special Topics Courses. Includes Game Theory I/II, Maximum Likelihood Estimation, Longitudinal Data Analysis, Experimental Methods, Survey Research Methods, Computational Modeling, and Advanced Topics: Bayesian Statistics.
prerequisites: QTM 110 and QTM 120 and QTM 210 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
instructors: Martin Van der Linden - Primary Instructor
